abstract: Pres Obama and British Prime Min David Cameron, during meeting at White House, pledge to work together closely to confront growing extremist threat around the world; announce they will step up efforts to strengthen cybersecurity and training of Iraqi military to bolster fight against Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron, vowing new cooperation after the terrorist attacks in Paris, agreed to bolster cybersecurity and step up training of Iraqi forces to counter the Islamic State.
snippet: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron, vowing new cooperation after the terrorist attacks in Paris, agreed to bolster cybersecurity and step up training of Iraqi forces to counter the Islamic State.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: U.S. and Britain Present a United Front
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Britain Present a United Front
